sentences.en: He has been unjustly dispossessed of his country.
Some of the dispossessed were persuaded to make a new life in Bolivia.
sentences.cn: 一部分失去土地的冲绳人被劝服,到玻利维亚开始新生活.

sentences.en: The tenant was dispossessed for not paying his rent.
sentences.cn: 那名房客因未付房租而被赶走.

sentences.en: The urban poor, too, came originally from dispossessed peasants.
sentences.cn: 城市贫民本来也是来源于破产的农民.

sentences.en: They have been unjustly dispossessed of their hometown.
They have dispossessed her of her house.
They have dispossessed him of his political rights.
sentences.cn: 他们剥夺了他的政治权力.

sentences.en: We must walk with our dispossessed brothers and sisters; Walk with God.
sentences.cn: 我们应该和无依无靠的哥哥和姐姐 结伴 同行.

sentences.en: We must walk with our dispossessed brothers and sisters.
sentences.cn: 我们必须拉我们无依无靠的兄弟姐妹们一把.

sentences.en: When the most dispossessed person in the poorest neighborhood receives the same treatment as the rich man living high upon the hill, civil society is strengthened and the police are ennobled.
sentences.cn: 当最贫困社区中的最无依无靠的人得到与在山坡豪宅中的富人同样的对待时，公民社会得到加强，警察的工作受到尊敬。

trans.tran_cn: 无依无靠的, 被逐出的
剥夺( dispossess的过去式和过去分词 )，使丧失，撵走，逐出
